physical_appearance:\This is a beige cheongsam that is paired with a long-sleeved matching jacket
 also beige in colour. The cheongsam has capped sleeves. There are floral patterns all over the jacket
 but not on the cheongsam. A collar is present on the cheongsam but not on the jacket
 which has a neckline instead. There is a pair of buttons at the mid-point of the front of the jacket. They are circular in shape. There are no visible tears on the cheongsam and the jacket. There is a label tag that is titled \\Johnson\\ located at the collar of the jacket.\
subject_terms_1:dresses (garments) womenswear floral patterns scalloping tailor-made

subject_terms_3:Ethnic costume Chinese costume
sgcool_label_text:This is a beige cheongsam with capped sleeves and a matching jacket. The jacket is of floral lace and has scalloped hemming at the collar
 which was popular in the late 1960s. The cheongsam is made in Hong Kong and has a tailor’s label
 “Johnson”.

metadata.physical_appearance: "This is a beige cheongsam that is paired with a long-sleeved matching jacket, also beige in colour. The cheongsam has capped sleeves. There are floral patterns all over the jacket, but not on the cheongsam. A collar is present on the cheongsam but not on the jacket, which has a neckline instead. There is a pair of buttons at the mid-point of the front of the jacket. They are circular in shape. There are no visible tears on the cheongsam and the jacket. There is a label tag that is titled ""Johnson"" located at the collar of the jacket."
